alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:37PM CDT until May 07 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Carver, Dakota and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Yellow Medicine, Renville and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Lac qui Parle and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. .Showers and thunderstorms have produced a decent amount of rainfall in spots today, however not widespread enough to cause any issues with our downwards trend in river levels. We expect to continue to see a downward trend despite further showers through the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading affected at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 702.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Friday was 702.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 698.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.5 feet on 03/24/1985. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
